ResourceHeader.Description: The TIDE Summary Spectrograms: There are four types of spectrogram plots. Half-orbit spectrograms cover all the data in consecutive plots, each plot covers about 9.3 hours. Perigee spectrograms cover the time period near perigee in 30-60 minute plots prior to 01/01/01 and 3 hour plots from 01/01/01 to 04/16/08. Plasmasphere spectrograms cover passes through the radiation belts when TIDE was in stand-by mode. 6-hour PSI spectrograms are consecutive plots of data when the Plasma Source Instrument (PSI) was turned on. For 1996 ion data, there are spectrograms plots for H+, O+, and He+ for data from 03/28/96 to 12/07/96. Each plot has three spectrograms. The top spectrogram is time versus spin angle. The energy flux data has been averaged over polar angle and energy. The middle spectrogram is time versus particle energy. The energy flux data has been averaged over spin and polar angle. The bottom spectrogram is time versus polar angle. The energy flux data has been averaged over spin angle and energy. For the Total Ion (Stops) data, there are plots for data from 12/08/96 to 04/16/08. Each plot has two spectrograms. The top spectrogram is time versus spin angle. The energy flux data has been averaged over energy. The bottom spectrogram is time versus particle energy. The energy flux data has been averaged over spin angle. The spin angle spectrogram indicates the spacecraft ram direction (X) and the magnetic field location (+ and -). Additional spacecraft information is listed as part of the time axis at the bottom of the plot. Processing information including start and stop times are at the top and the bottom of each plot.

InformationURL.Name: TIDE GSFC Home Page
InformationURL.Description: The TIDE Home Page contains links to all available information about the instrument, its data and software, summary plot viewing, interactive data processing (Custom Plots and Data Dumps), mission information, and documentation about the website, data, and the processing software.

InformationURL.Name: TIDE GSFC Summary Plot Gifwalk
InformationURL.Description: The TIDE Summary Plot Gifwalk lets the user scan through TIDE high time resolution spectrogram plots for the entire Polar mission. The user selects the ion type: Total (Ion), H+, O+, or He+; the year, month, and day to start the viewing; the spectrogram type: half-orbit, perigee, 6-hr PSI operations, or plasmasphere passes; and then presses Update Date/Type/Ion. Once the gif image is displayed, there are arrow keys that allow the user to move forward and backward in time. The user can download the gif by right click / save picture as or click on Download the pdf version to see and download the higher quality pdf plot. There is a TIDE Website navigation bar at the bottom of the webpage. The user can zoom in on an area of interest by clicking on the image at that point. That takes the user to the High Time Resolution Spectrogram Custom Plot Webpage, where after changing any default processing options and Submitting Request, a new spectrogram plot will be created.

InformationURL.Name: TIDE GSFC View Thumbnails
InformationURL.Description: The TIDE Thumbnails webpage provides a way to view several TIDE summary spectrograms quickly. Just specify the time range and select the ion and the spectrogram type (either half-orbit or perigee) and submit request. Thumbnails of each spectrogram in the time range are displayed 8 per row. Move the mouse over a thumbnail to get the start time of the plot. Click on the thumbnail to view the full size gif and get a link to the pdf.

AccessURL.Description: PDF and JPEG formats are also available via this access url
